Hello,

Sorry for the late response. I recently found out the issue and I w=
ant to post it here just in case other people have the same issue.
The step=
s needed to reproduce the "weird situation" :
1). create a job like :=A0cur=
l -v -d "createpath=3Dmyjob&action=3Dcreate" -k -u admin:admin --anyauth --=
location -H "Accept: application/xml"=A0https://localhost:8443/engine
2). m=
ake Heritrix crash (ie. hammer it until it throws an out of memory exceptio=
n)
3). =A0configure a job like :=A0curl -v -T my-crawler-beans.cxml -k -u a=
dmin:admin --anyauth --location=A0https://localhost:8443/engine/job/myjob/j=
obdir/crawler-beans.cxml

The story : when Heritrix is out of memory it doe=
s not reconfigure your job but just puts your file in the job folder (ie. l=
ike you would upload it with REST).

Cheers
Paul.



______________________=
__________
 From: Noah Levitt <nlevitt@...>
To: archive-crawler@yah=
oogroups.com 
Cc: paul.ihde <paul.ihde@...> 
Sent: Thursday, July 26,=
 2012 4:14 AM
Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Weird behavior with job folder=

 
Hello Paul,

How are you submitting jobs?

I would create the job with h=
ttp post, then upload the job config with http put, e.g.

$ curl -v -d "cre=
atepath=3Dmyjob&action=3Dcreate" -k -u admin:admin --anyauth --location -H =
"Accept: application/xml" https://localhost:8443/engine
$ curl -v -T my-cra=
wler-beans.cxml -k -u admin:admin --anyauth --location https://localhost:84=
43/engine/job/myjob/jobdir/crawler-beans.cxml

See https://webarchive.jira.=
com/wiki/display/Heritrix/Heritrix+3.x+API+Guide

Noah


On 2012-07-23 14:4=
2 , paul.ihde wrote:
> Hi,
>
> I'm using the Heritrix 3.1 REST API to creat=
e/launch/etc. jobs via a http client.
> Recently I ran into a rather weird =
behavior : all my submited jobs appear in the heritrix "jobs" folder as pla=
in xml files (one xml file per job):
> * job1-beans.xml
> * job2-beans.xml
=
> ...
>
> instead of folders (one folder per job) :
> * job1
> * job2
> * e=
tc.
>
> I'm curious if anyone ran into this kind of issue before and if you=
 guys have any suggestions on how to solve this issue.
>
> Regards
> Paul.
=
>
>
>
>
